00032 // FASTDB_DEBUG - debug level
00033 //    - DEBUG_NONE - disable any checking and tracing (except asserts)
00034 //    - DEBUG_CHECK - disable trace message
00035 //    - DEBUG_TRACE_IMPORTANT - enable trace of important messages 
00036 //    - DEBUG_TRACE_ALL - enable trace of all messages 
00037 #define FASTDB_DEBUG DEBUG_TRACE_IMPORTANT
00038 //#define FASTDB_DEBUG DEBUG_TRACE_ALL

00040 // USE_NAMESPACES - place FastDB classes in separate namespace

00043 // SECURE_SERVER - enable authentication for remote logins: keep user/password table, 
00044 //   check password for remote logins
00045 //#define SECURE_SERVER 1
00046 
00047 // USE_QUEUE_MANAGER - use queue manager for internal HTTP server. 
00048 //   This manager will manage pool of threads assigned for client connections. 
00049 //   Otherwise all requests will be executed sequnetially in the main loop.
00050 //#define USE_QUEUE_MANAGER 1

00100 #ifdef VXWORKS
00101 #define USE_POSIX_SEMAPHORES 1
00102 #endif // VXWORKS
00103 //USE_POSIX_SEMAPHORES use POSIX sem_* sempahores instead of SysV semaphores
00104 //     instead of SysV semaphores and shared memory
00105 //#define USE_POSIX_SEMAPHORES 1
00106 
00107 
00108 //USE_POSIX_MMAP - if 1 then use Posix mmap for mapping database file and monitor, 
00109 //  if 0 - use SysV IPC shmem for allocating memory for database file and monitor,
00110 //  if not defined - use mmap for mapping database file and shmem for allocating monitor
00111 //#define USE_POSIX_MMAP 0
00112 
00113 //REPLICATION_SUPPORT - fault tolerant version of FastDB
00114 //#define REPLICATION_SUPPORT 1
00115 
00116 #ifdef VXWORKS
00117 #define NO_MMAP 1
00118 #endif
00119 //NO_MMAP do not use OS mappig of file on virtual memory. FastDB will track modification of
00120 //  pages itself and save dirty pages in the file. If USE_POSIX_MMAP=0, memory for database is
00121 //  allocated using shmat() and database can be shared by several processes, 
00122 //  otherwise - using valloc() and database can be accessed only by one process. 
00123 //#define NO_MMAP 1
00124 
00125 //FUZZY_CHECKPOINT allows to increase application performance, by performing writing to the file in 
00126 //  in a separate thread. In this case commit will not be blocked until all changes will be actually written to the disk,
00127 //  write requests will be just linked into the queue from which them will be taken by writting thread and proceeded
00128 //  in the same order as in commit. This apporach provides daatbase consistency in case of fault, but results
00129 //  of several recently committed transaction can be lost in this case.
00130 //  Fuzzy checkpointing works only in conjunction with NO_MMAP option, it means that data sharing is not allowed
00131 //  in this case - database can be accessed only by one application.
00132 //#define FUZZY_CHECKPOINT 1
00133 
00134 
00135 //USE_MFC - use MFC (include "afx.h" instead of "windows.h")
00136 //#define USE_MFC 1
00137 
00138 //USE_ATL - use Microsoft ATL 
00139 //#define USE_ATL 1
00140 
00141 // LARGE_DATABASE_SUPPORT - support databases with size larger than 4Gb.
00142 // If this macro is defined GigaBASE maximal database size is limited by 1 terrabyte.
00143 // Defnining this macro increase iniitial database size and object index size (because
00144 // 64-bit offsetss are used instead fo 4-byte offsets). Also GigaBASE library compiled with 
00145 // LARGE_DATABASE_SUPPOR will not be able to work with database created by library
00146 // built without LARGE_DATABASE_SUPPOR and visa versa. 
00147 //#define LARGE_DATABASE_SUPPORT 
00148 
00149 // dbDatabaseOidBits number of bits used to represent object identifier. 
00150 // So the number of objects in database is limited by 2**dbDatabaseOidBits.
00151 // Default value of this parameter is 32, so maximal number of objects is limited by 2**32.
00152 // The value of this parameter is used to estimate size of bitmap, so do not assign unnecessarily 
00153 // large values (for example 64)
00154 //#define dbDatabaseOidBits 33
00155 
00156 // Do not use member templates
00157 #if defined(__SUNPRO_CC_COMPAT) && __SUNPRO_CC_COMPAT == 4
00158 #define  NO_MEMBER_TEMPLATES
00159 #endif
00160 
00161 // Automatically detect and recover crash of one or more database clients.
00162 // FastDB will start separate watchdog threads which will check if other processes working with database are 
00163 // alive.
00164 // It is not recommended to use this mode because there are many cases when it works incorrectly.
00165 // Preferable way of handling process failure is using of RECOVERABLE_CRITICAL_SECTION.
00166 //#define AUTO_DETECT_PROCESS_CRASH 1
00167 
00168 // Use recoverable critical section (operating system is able to release 
00169 // critical section in case of crash of the process entered this critical section)
00170 //#define RECOVERABLE_CRITICAL_SECTION 1
00171 
00172 // Do not flush chages to the disk during transaction commit. This option will greatly increase performance
00173 // but can cause database corruption in case of crash
00174 //#define NO_FLUSH_ON_COMMIT 1
00175 
00176 // dbDatabaseOidBits number of bits used to represent object identifier. 
00177 // So the number of objects in database is limited by 2**dbDatabaseOidBits.
00178 // Default value of this parameter is 32, so maximal number of objects is limited by 2**32.
00179 // Support of larger number of objects is possible only at 64-bit OS
00180 // The value of this parameter is used to estimate size of bitmap, so do not assign unnecessarily 
00181 // large values (for example 64)
00182 //#define dbDatabaseOidBits 33
00183 
00184 // dbDatabaseOffsetBits number of bits used to represent object offset in the storage
00185 // So the maximal database size is limited by 2**dbDatabaseOidBits.
00186 // Default value of this parameter is 32, so maximal number of objects is limited by 2**32.
00187 // Support of larger database size only at 64-bit OS
00188 // The value of this parameter is used to estimate size of bitmap, so do not assign unnecessarily 
00189 // large values (for example 64)
00190 //#define dbDatabaseOffsetBits 38
00191 
00192 // USE_REGEX - use regex library. When this macro is defined GigaBASE provides
00193 // MATCH command. GNU regex or compatible library and headers should be available.
00194 //#define USE_REGEX true
00195

00214 // Protect replica from unintended access (data corruption)

00217 // Wait acknowledgment that transaction is delivered to all slave nodes
00218 //#define SYNCHRONOUS_REPLICATION true
00219 
00220 // PAD_HEADER - add pad field to the database header to make it possible to transfer 
00221 // file between systems with different alignment rules
00222 // This pad field was unconditionally inserted in database header in 3.17 version
00223 // of Perst which breaks backward compatibility. Because of the customers concerns
00224 // in 3.39 version of Perst the "pad" field was wrapped with the following condition
00225 // #if dbDatabaseOffsetBits > 32 && defined(ALIGN_HEADER)
00226 // which in turn breaks compatibility with database created with 3.17-3.38 versions.
00227 // Finally in 3.44 the condition was repalced with 
00228 // #if (dbDatabaseOffsetBits > 32 && defined(ALIGN_HEADER)) || defined(PAD_HEADER)
00229 // So you should uncomment definition of PAD_HEADER to preserve compatibility with databases 
00230 // created by FastDB versions 3.17-3.38.
00231 //#define PAD_HEADER
00232 
00233 // ALIGN_HEADER - align each field of dbHeader class on its page boudary
00234 // to make it possible to transfer file between systems with different alignment rules
00235 //#define ALIGN_HEADER true
00236 
00237 // DO_NOT_REUSE_OID_WITHIN_SESSION - do not reuse OID of deallocated objects in the current session
00238 //#define DO_NOT_REUSE_OID_WITHIN_SESSION true
